highlights: Engineered a dual-mode file carving tool operable as a standalone CLI or an importable Python library, exposing a clean public API (scan_path, scan_files) fully decoupled from CLI concerns for seamless integration into forensics pipelines.

Integrated Google Magika's deep-learning-based content detection as a MIME validation layer to re-identify every carved candidate against its expected signature, significantly reducing false positives on fragmented or corrupted media.

Designed a structured FileScanResult dataclass with typed fields (mime_type, label, status, error) and serialization support, replacing raw dict returns to enforce type safety and improve downstream interoperability.

Implemented production-grade engineering patterns including per-file error isolation, standard logging throughout (no rogue print calls), CI-friendly exit codes, and a pluggable YAML signature registry for extending file type detection without code changes.
